intro: Mollinedia lepidota, commonly known as the silverleaf mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive, textured appearance. Mollinedia lepidota is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
